attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -40.75 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +83 pieces

ü  All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·    The management to ensure that observed strong internal controls are adhered to.
attributes.effect:
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

+ This also implies that the company is not exposed to the risk of item loss.

value: · More improvement measures will be initiated.
+ Control is ok and will maintain the trend.
+ Physical stock count on 25.02.2025 showed polybags shortfall of 705pcs (cumulatively).
Previous

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 26.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.

+ Minimal item variation was noted for stock verification done.

+ This shows accountability of company items.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Dough weights:

Dough was sampled on 26.03.25.

+ Average dough weight was within the set standard dough weight range.

+ Overweight rate was above the allowed 10% of total samples weighed.

·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 26/03/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 26.03.2025:(1st shift @09.30am)
attributes.recommendation: + Noted overweight dough should be addressed. Set sough dividing weight range should be adhered to.
attributes.effect: + Overweight dough lowers yield targets. This also reduces revenue targets.

value: + We will put necessary measures to ensure that dividers adhered to set dividing weight ranges.
+ Noted high overweight dough samples will be addressed.
Dough weights not tested during previous audit.
Current
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High overweight dough rate detected hence non-compliance to set dividing weight range.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard dough dividing weight range.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight
attributes.description:
Packed bread weights.

Packed bread was weighed on 26.03.2025.

+ Overweight bread rate was high.
attributes.recommendation:
·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to check bread weight extremes and ensure production of standard weight bread.

 + High overweight bread rate noted should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
+ Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing. This is justified by dough high overweight rate.

+  Overweight bread noted reduces yield targets hence withholding revenues.

value: + We will sensitize dough dividers to adhere to set dough weight ranges in order to address high overweight bread noted.
+ We will ensure compliance of set dough dividing weights in order to check extreme bread weights.
+ Packed bread weighed on 28.02.25 showed high underweight rate for 800g white bread which was 13.95% of sample weighed.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of dough and packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High overweight bread rate was noted. Hence non-compliance to set standard bread weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard packed bread weights.

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/03/2025 - 25/03/2025.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          Noted adherence to production and packing set standards is commendable.

·          Branch management should ensure observed proper planning is maintained.
attributes.effect: + Adherence to set operational efficiency standards checked production costs.

value: + Set standard packing and production efficiencies will be maintained.
+ Noted trend will be maintained and even improved.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that bread damages were within the accepted range as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 24.02.2025.
Previous
+ This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ There was compliance to set bread damage rate.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set allowable bread damage rate.

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers,
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted 2 incidences whereby data on mixing charts was wrongly transferred to mixing charts summary..
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.03.25 – 25.01.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Raw material set standard consumption quantities were adhered to. Hence compliance to set consumption standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that raw materials set consumption standard was adhered to.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
+ Individual bread yields on mixing chart summaries and SAP system were analyzed from 01.03.25 - 25.03.25.

+ Bread yields were compared  to those expected.

+ Expected bread yields were realized.
attributes.recommendation: + Set yield targets should be adhered to maximize revenues as observed.
attributes.effect: + Revenue targets were realized through achieving expected yields.

value: + We will maintain the observed trend.
+ We will always ensured that expected yields are achieved.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that expected yields were realized.
Previous
+ Analysis was carried out to determine prevailing yields and establish if they are at par with those expected.
+ Expected yields were achieved hence bread yield compliance.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring expected yields are achieved.

attributes.title: Daily debtors analysis (outstanding customer balance)
attributes.description:
+ Debtor analysis as at 28.03.25 showed outstanding customer balances.

·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs.50,310.65.
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: + High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.

value:
·    We don’t supply customers with outstanding debts in that the SAP system is locked such that it doesn’t allow invoicing for such customers.

+ Debt in the account of Tuk Tuk will be recovered from the driver security deposit.

·  Will follow up with the sales rep and the TSM, at the moment all customers with balances aren’t supplied until the debt is cleared.

+ However, most of this balances are with customers with security deposits equal or more compared to the debt.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted outstanding debt of Kshs. 17,564.47 as at 1st march 2025.
Previous
·    Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 28th March 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding customer balances was noted.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that no route or mini shop has outstanding customer balance,

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 01/03/2025 - 25/03/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Noted adherence to production  set standards is commendable.

·          Branch management should ensure observed proper planning is maintained.

value: + Set standard packing and production efficiencies will be maintained.
+ Noted trend will be maintained and even improved.
+ Analysis from 01.02.25 - 24.02.25 showed that production workers were hired in excess by 1person hence surplus wage payment of Kshs. 1,086.60.
Previous
+ This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Expected production efficiency was realized hence compliance to set operational efficiencies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set production efficiency was realized.

PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted adherence to  packing set standards is commendable.

value: + Set standard packing and production efficiencies will be maintained.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle set standard fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: ·           Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards is as follows;
attributes.recommendation: + Vehicles having set standard fuel consumption is commendable.

value: + We only use vehicles that have set standard fuel consumption rate.
+ Vehicles have set fuel consumption standard rates.
+ February 2025 audit report showed that all motor vehicles had set standard fuel consumption rate.
Previous
+ Motor vehicle mileage register was scrutinized to check if all vehicles had set standard fuel consumption rate.
+ All vehicles have set fuel consumption rates. Hence, policy of having each vehicle fuel consumption rate determined was complied to.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that each sales van has set standard fuel consumption rate set by KAF.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Motor vehicle fuel consumption was analyzed to determine if expected fuel consumption equated to actual fuel awarded.

+ Motor vehicle fuel consumption was as per expected.

+ Fuel consumption is analyzed on the table below.
attributes.recommendation: + Economical fuel consumption for sales vans is commendable,
attributes.effect: + Economical fuel consumption checks operation costs.

value: +  Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+ We will maintain the observed trend.
+ February 2025 audit report showed economical fuel consumption for motor vehicles for the month of February 2025.
Previous

+    The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption was economical by all vehicles.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that fuel consumed by vehicles was as per expected.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption
attributes.description: GENERATOR : (01/03/25 - 31/03/25)
attributes.recommendation:
+ Consistent generator fuel consumption is commendable.

+ Standard fuel consumption rate should be set for the generator.
attributes.effect: + Economical generator fuel consumption checked operation cost.

value: + We always enquire on the fuel quantity to be purchased from personnel managing probe system and all fuel purchased is drained in the generator.
+ Generator fuel is fully accounted for.
+ Generator fuel consumption from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25 was 32.9lts/hour.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by  generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Economical generator fuel consumption was noted.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that generator fuel consumption was that expected.
